alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Carver; Dakota; Hennepin; Ramsey; Scott; Sherburne; Washington; Wright (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 12:20PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...STRONG WIND GUSTS ACROSS EAST CENTRAL MINNESOTA... Strong wind gusts behind a decaying line of rain showers will persist over much of east central Minnesota, including the Twin Cities metro, through the early afternoon hours. Wind gusts may reach 35-45 mph at times. This may produce downed tree branches and power lines. In addition, this may cause hazardous boating conditions on area lakes along with hazardous travel conditions for high profile vehicles, including campers, particularly in open areas. If at any outdoor event, take precautions by securing loose objects and taking appropriate shelter, if necessary. If out on area lakes, try to return to harbor and wait out the winds, or if unable, ensure everyone aboard is wearing approved life jackets. The winds are expected to subside by early afternoon. Showers and thunderstorms are expected to re-develop this afternoon and evening so have a plan of action if attending any outdoor activities later today. Keep up with the latest forecasts and statements, especially if watches and warnings are issued.
